p: The viral ribonucleoprotein complex (vRNP) is a rod-shaped structure composed of multiple copies of NP and a single trimeric RNA-dependent RNA polymerase complex (PB1, PB2, and PA) associated with viral genomic RNA [ 25]. NP mediates nuclear import of the vRNP complex, the PB1 subunit has the catalytic polymerase activity, the PB2 subunit contributes to cap binding, and the PA subunit is required for cleavage of the capped oligonucleotides. The complex is required for the transcription and replication of the viral genome [ 26]. The structure, functions, and modulation of the IAV RNA polymerase complex were further discussed by Te Velthuis and Fordor [ 27]. However, the mechanism of vRNP assembly remains largely unknown and several host proteins were reported to be involved during IAV infection [ 28, 29, 30]. Recently, eleuthe roside B 1 was demonstrated to be able to inhibit the vRNP in vitro [ 31].
